content:
SecurityTokenSerializer Class

Definition

Represents a class that can read and write key identifiers, key identifier clauses, and security tokens.

In this Article

public abstract class SecurityTokenSerializer
Inheritance
System.Object
SecurityTokenSerializer

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Use the SecurityTokenSerializer class to read and write SecurityKeyIdentifier, SecurityKeyIdentifierClause, and SecurityToken classes as XML. The SecurityTokenSerializer class has methods to determine whether this class can read and write these entities and to actually read and write them. For security tokens, these methods are CanReadToken, CanWriteToken, ReadToken, and WriteToken.

Constructors

SecurityTokenSerializer()

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenSerializer class.

protected SecurityTokenSerializer ();

Methods

CanReadKeyIdentifier(XmlReader)

Determines whether this serializer can read the <KeyIdentifier> element referred to by the specified XML reader.

public bool CanReadKeyIdentifier (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
reader
XmlReader

An XmlReader to read the key identifier.

Returns
Boolean

true when the specified <KeyIdentifier> XML element can be read; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

reader is null.

Remarks

Classes that derive from the SecurityTokenSerializer class must override the CanReadKeyIdentifierCore(XmlReader) method. The CanReadKeyIdentifier method calls the CanReadKeyIdentifierCore method.

CanReadKeyIdentifierClause(XmlReader)

Determines whether this serializer can read a clause in a <KeyIdentifier> element referred to by the specified XML reader.

public bool CanReadKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
reader
XmlReader

An XmlReader to read the key identifier clause.

Returns
Boolean

true when the specified key identifier clause can be read; otherwise, false.

ArgumentNullException

reader is null.

Remarks

Classes that derive from the SecurityTokenSerializer class must override the CanReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore(XmlReader) method. The CanReadKeyIdentifierClause method calls the CanReadKeyIdentifierClauseCore method.

Determines whether this serializer can read the <KeyIdentifier> element referred to by the specified XML reader. Called by the base class.
